See also: wein and wéin

German[edit]

German Wikipedia has an article on:
Wein
Wikipedia de

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German wīn, from Old High German wīn, from Proto-Germanic *wīną, from Latin vīnum, from Proto-Indo-European *wóih₁nom.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /vaɪ̯n/
  • Rhymes: -aɪ̯n
  • audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Wein m (genitive Weines or Weins, plural Weine)

  1. wine

Declension[edit]

Declension of Wein

indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinderWeindieWeine
genitiveeinesdesWeines,
Weins		derWeine
dativeeinemdemWein,
Weine1		denWeinen
accusativeeinendenWeindieWeine
1Now uncommon, see notes

Derived terms[edit]

  • weinartig
  • Wasser predigen und Wein trinken

Hunsrik[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /vaɪ̯n/

Noun[edit]

Wein m (plural Weine, diminutive Weinche)

  1. wine
    Ich drinke keen Wein.
    I don't drink wine.

Further reading[edit]

  • Online Hunsrik Dictionary

Rhine Franconian[edit]

Noun[edit]

Wein

  1. (Palatine) wine
